meanings.definition: To gradually reduce or write off a debt by making regular payments.
meanings.sent1: I will amortize my loan by paying a little bit every month.
meanings.sent2: She amortizes her mortgage by making monthly payments.
meanings.sent3: The bank clerk joked that if you don't amortize your debt, it will haunt you like a ghost.
meanings.sent4: Just like a candle slowly burning down, the debt will amortize over time.
meanings.sent5: Amortizing a debt is like chipping away at a mountain, one small piece at a time.

meanings.definition: To spread out the cost of an expense over a period of time.
meanings.sent1: We decided to amortize the cost of the new furniture over six months.
meanings.sent2: Amortizing the renovation expenses helped us manage our budget better.
meanings.sent3: The family joked that they would have to amortize the pizza bill over a year.
meanings.sent4: Amortizing the expense felt like stretching a rubber band to cover the distance.
meanings.sent5: She amortized the vacation cost, making each day feel like a small payment towards happiness.

meanings.definition: To depreciate or write off an intangible asset over a period of time.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to amortize the patent value over five years.
meanings.sent2: Amortizing the software development costs helped balance the books.
meanings.sent3: The accountant humorously suggested they amortize the brand value like a fine wine.
meanings.sent4: The value of the trademark will slowly amortize, like colors fading in the sun.
meanings.sent5: Amortizing the intangible asset felt like watching a balloon deflate slowly over time.
